January 3, 1953
Dictated by Mr* Ausraus
and signed in his absence
Hr* Burton Paulu
KUOK, University of Minnesota
Minneapolis lU# Minnesota
Dear Burtons
Tic re are so many urgent matters which we have to take
care of that X am going ahead with the meeting in Urbana on the
8th and 9th* I am asking lick to come over from Ames though X
have no assurarce he can make it* Xou indicate in your letter
of December 2li that you might be able to meet with us if we could
meet in Minneapolis, but I think this will be impractical* The
purpose of this note is to request that you squeeze in just one
day with us in Urbana if at all possible*
At the Urbana meeting we should be able to wrap up plans
for the training of educational TV workers, plans for the educa¬
tional TV seminar, final decision on the Executive Director, ad
should do some pretty clear thinking on the relationship of the
Radio and TV Program Center and our NAKB Tape Network* I have
asked Bob VanDuyu to come down to Urbana to meet with us at least
one-half day so that we can get his thinking on those and some
other problems* Xou will recall that I asked Burton and Parka*
to draw up recommendations for the educational TV seminar for viiich
FAE has promised five thousand collars* Xou are also aware that both
Dick and Parker recommended that this be abolished in light of the
preoccupation on the local, state, aid national levels ♦with educa¬
tional TV development* I discussed this possibility, briefly with
Griffiths in California and he was of the opinion that we should
pin down a positive date at a later time right away unless we expect
to abandon the idea entirely* The broader training program cannot
be conceived as a place for developing a phiJ&iophy for educational
IV and I feel that it is still highly desirable that we spend some
time on this and plan definitely to go ahead with the seminar* I
would appreciate your reaction*
Skornia is in the bag for ten thousand beginning June 1
and Schooley will become Acting Executive Director effective
February 1 and continuing until June* Jim has talked to VanDuyn
about this and finds him in complete agreement on it* I had
discussed it with him at our convention in Minneapolis and had
been assured of his willingness to accept this arrangement*
